definition: (of complexion) to lose one's color/to blanch/wan

sentences.english: Joyfulness keeps the heart and face young.
sentences.chinese: 歡樂能夠讓心態和容顏保持年輕。

sentences.english: At that moment I become widely known, not for fame and gain, but meet you again.
sentences.chinese: 那一刻我萬衆矚目，不爲名利，只爲再見你的容顏。

sentences.english: You said do not care about my height, looks ugly.
sentences.chinese: 你說過不在乎我的身高貌寢容顏。

sentences.english: Don't blame the aging looks on time, in fact ourselves are the dressers.
sentences.chinese: 別怪韶光改人容顏，我們自己纔是那個化妝師。

sentences.english: Her wistful face haunt my dreams like the rain at night.
sentences.chinese: 她充滿渴望的容顏，如夜雨一般，縈繞於我的夢境。

sentences.english: At the sight of her matchless beauty, both the princes were bewitched.
sentences.chinese: 看見她美麗無比的容顏時，兩個王子都被迷住了。

sentences.english: Beauty is not in the face, beauty is a light in the heart. - Kahil Gibran.
sentences.chinese: 美貌並不在於容顏，而是內心的那一束光。

sentences.english: Skills of living, Ultimate body effect, Newness appearance, Healthy & safety.
sentences.chinese: 養生絕技，內調外護，容顏更新，健康安全。

sentences.english: Never laughing can help keep your appearance from wrinkling and getting uglier .
sentences.chinese: 永遠不笑可以幫助保持容顏，阻止皺紋的產生和變醜。

sentences.english: To reming me just the memory of you face.
sentences.chinese: 能讓我想起記憶中你的容顏。

sentences.english: Her face is beautiful; her manner is charming; her mouth is full of honeyed words.
sentences.chinese: 她容顏姣好，風姿綽約，滿口甜言蜜語。

sentences.english: See you when that dream appearance.
sentences.chinese: 何時再見那夢中的容顏。

sentences.english: Just close your eyes , and see , her face , who loves you.
sentences.chinese: 閉上雙眼你會看到那愛你之人的容顏。

sentences.english: I saw your face in a crowded p(a)lace.
sentences.chinese: 我見到你容顏，在擁擠的行宮裏。

sentences.english: Your appearance in my mind float, just like the water moon bright at night.
sentences.chinese: 你的容顏在我的腦海裏浮蕩着，就像夜晚水中的皓月。

definition: to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
great changes/ups and downs/vicissitudes/abbr. of 滄海桑田|沧海桑田[cang1 hai3 sang1 tian2]
